original: Elowson, Sten Petri, provinsialläkare, Ingelstad, f. 16/9/98 i Väsby, Malmöh. 1., av bankdir. Elof Andersson o. Paulina Persson. G. 28 m. Anna Lisa Baagöe. Barn: Gunilla f. 35. — Stud:ex. i Hälsingb. 18, med. kand. 22 o. med. lic. 27 i Lund. As-sist läk. v. Landskr. las. 27-28, tf. und :läk. där 28, und :läk. v, Apelvikens kustsan. 29-30, andre und :läk. v. Lidköp. las. 30-31, förste 31-32, tf. prov:läk. i Båstads’, Karlskoga o. Heby distr. 32-313, tf. andre resp. förste und :läk. v. Målilla san. 33, tf. prov :läk. i Upps. distr. 33-34, i Hälsingb. distr. 34, i Ta-nums distr. 34-35 o. i Heby distr. 35- 36, e. läk. v. Sundby sjukh, 37, tf. pro-v:läk. i Sollebrunns distr. 37-38, därjämte ett flert. kort. förordn. i cl. distr., e. proviläk. i Kristdala distr. 38, prov:läk. i Kyrkhults- distr. 40-47, i Ingelstads distr. sed. 47.
translated: Elowson, Sten Petri was a provincial physician from Ingelstad. He was born on September 16th, 1898 in Väsby, Malmöh, the first child of bank director Elof Andersson and Paulina Persson. He married Anna Lisa Baagöe in 1928 and they had one child, Gunilla, born in 1935. He graduated from Hälsingborgs Stud:ex in 1918, received his medical degree in 1922, and his medical license in 1927 from Lund University. He worked as an assistant physician at Landskrona Hospital from 1927-1928, temporary deputy physician there in 1928, deputy physician at Apelviken's Coastal Sanatorium from 1929-1930, second deputy physician at Lidköping Hospital from 1930-1931, first deputy physician at the same hospital from 1931-1932, temporary provincial physician in Båstad, Karlskoga, and Heby districts from 1932-1933, temporary second and then first deputy physician at Målilla Sanatorium in 1933, temporary provincial physician in Uppsala district in 1933-34, in Hälsingborg district in 1934, Tanum district in 1934-35, and Heby district in 1935-36. He worked as a physician at Sundby Hospital in 1937, temporary provincial physician in Sollebrunn district in 1937-38 and had several short-term assignments in various districts. He was the provincial physician in Kristdala district in 1938 and in Kyrkhult district from 1940-1947. He worked as the provincial physician in Ingelstad district from 1947 until the end of his career.
